intro: Grammitis hirsuta, commonly known as hairy gametophyte fern, is a species of fern that belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its dense, moss-like appearance and small, delicate leaves. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Grammitis hirsuta has a unique reproductive structure, with the gametophyte stage being more prominent than the sporophyte. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in plant morphology and ecology.
